lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome back to Critical Role! We've had a two-week hiatus due to illness and traveling, but we're back, and we're a little late today because of traffic in Los Angeles, which is always a pleasurable experience.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is what happens when you get half the cast in a session together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In Santa Monica.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was good times! We love you, Steve! You did great! But no, so, we're happy to be here, we missed you guys, we missed each other, and the rest of our team just arrived as well.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sam!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, first and foremost, I want to let you guys know that Tor Books has been nice enough to help sponsor tonight's episode of content, so you guys have seen announcements and stuff for their new book, Bands of Mourning, which we had at the last game, you being a Brandon Sanderson fan for a long time.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Huge Brandon Sanderson Fan. We've talked about this. Yeah, we've talked about this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's good, good stuff. I've been perpetually prodded about whether or not that's me on the cover. It's not, but if they ever option it for a film it is.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Oh, you'd be a good Wax! You'd be a good Waxilum. He was the lead character.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, see, there we go. Read the books, then write a screenplay, then get it optioned, and then cast me.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Easy, it's Hollywood!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How hard could that be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, have fun! Next up, announcements, me and Marisha want to give a big shoutout and thanks to Kaizoku Con in Ireland. We had a wonderful time meeting a bunch of you Critters over there on the green isle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there Critters in Ireland?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dude! They were out in force! It was amazing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, and there were a bunch of people who came over from England, as well. We had a couple people from Egypt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Egypt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was really, really cool. So thank you guys for all coming out and visiting us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This episode is also sponsored by Jameson.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Because we got a lot of it when we were there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, Ireland!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, for those of you who have tried out the Order of the Lycan for my Blood Hunter build, I did an update last night. Minor tweaks. Basically, just clarifying some of the rules for dex builds, as well as some minor balance adjustments, but go check it out! Beyond that, all the feedback's been really positive. I don't foresee any major tweaks in the near future, so that's good. Marisha, you wanted to pitch your new show that's coming out here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I have a new show coming out on Geek and Sundry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa, is that true?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's it called?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Eeey!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Everyone's doing Fonzie!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is it? What happens on the show?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anyway, it's called Signal Boost, and there's actually going to be a never-before-seen promo airing during the intermission, but yeah, I'm hosting the first run, and I'm producing it, and Sean Becker is directing it, and it's written by Eric Campbell, so it should be very fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you boost signals in it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do boost lots of signals.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it just about optimizing your home Wi-Fi network?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A hundred percent. It's sponsored by Time Warner Cable. It's great. Yeah. Check it, no it's not, that would be awful.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It's going to be on from two to six? Or six to eight, or whenever they want to show up?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, six to six, got to be there. May get service.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. We'll have that video at the break today. Let's see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's airing on Tuesday. On geekandsundry.com.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Huzzah. Laura, you have something you just got a chance to talk about recently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that's pretty exciting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because no one had any clue--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Any idea. I know, I'd already had a bunch of messages on Twitter, but I couldn't confirm them until the 8th, and I finally can.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Yay NDAs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But in conjunction with that, Liam McIntyre, who is one of-- he also leads in the game--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's confusing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, right? I already like him because his name is Liam, but, and I also like him because he's a nerd. And I say this because he just started a Kickstarter for a card game that he developed called Monster Lab, so if you guys want to check it out, it's really really cute, it's really really fun, I think it's been going for like 15 days. They're doing really well on the Kickstarter but now they're going for stretch goals, so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Monster Lab.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Monster Lab on Kickstarter. Ah yes. Taliesin, you had something you wanted to go through?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Apparently, and it's a lot of fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're perfect for that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. (incoherent grumbling)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So much fun. You should wear a pot on your head all the time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You really don't like the hair, do you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's awesome!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's a light-- it's a color absorber, it's really cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I went fishing for that one, that was nice.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, and I got these really cool horns.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're so cute!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And my ring of flask. My one ring. Thank you to everybody.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One scotch to bind them all together.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's apple juice! They gave me the flask, not what's in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Liam, you said you wanted to--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it's so good!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And also, if you need to put your dice in something, you should go to wyrmwoodgaming.com and use the code 'critrole,' which will get you free shipping.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You put your dice in the thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, look at this beautiful box.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're beautiful. Many of you have been purchasing them. They're lovely to make nice presents for yourself or for another person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is what happens when we're gone for two weeks, we have to cram all of our backup, like, catchup announcements and little friend-bumps there at the front.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's hear it also for the app called Waze, which got me here at 7:20 instead of 7:45.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. No. Well, that's true, but we used it right away and we got here 20 minutes earlier than him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Mm-hm. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Waze, if you're looking to throw some sponsor dollars around.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Pull out the Morgan Freeman voice. We love it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (Morgan Freeman voice) You got to make sure you get to your place on time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, can I do one quick shoutout?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My friend Mark Whitten has a DND-based webseries starting tomorrow called Rolling High, I think it's youtube/rollinghigh, check it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Delightful! Wondrous. Anything else, any other announcements, anything crazy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got a new note-taking pen. Look at all the colors.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Solid announcement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, let's do it, guys, let's step on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is where we need the light change.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Upon going to Vasselheim, you managed to encounter a number of old friends from the Slayer's Take and enlist them for the time being to help you with the refugees and your current wanderings here in the city proper. At the same time, you encountered Lady Kima, who also has agreed to help with the events in Whitestone and this entire dragon attack towards the east, and you, after wandering the city for a bit, retrieving these allies, followed Grog into the Trial Forge, where you had a conversation with Earthbreaker Groon. And by conversation I mean a full-on drag-out sandpit battle to prove your worth to him, in which case you were given information about these things called the Vestiges of the Divergence, artifacts of great legendary power that existed from previous wars that had wiped out most of society multiple times. These Vestiges have been scattered around the world, many of them lost to the history books or passed down as symbols of power through various bloodlines or government positions, or stolen and haven't been seen for hundreds of years. You've found the location of two of them, one of which was the Titanstone Knuckles, and the other happened to be some sort of a leather, a Deathwalker's Leather that belonged to a champion of the Raven Queen. This exists in apparently the champion's tomb, which used to exist to the west of Vasselheim until it eventually sunk into the ground as the topography shifted over time and resides beneath a lake known as the Marrowglade Loch. So. That is where we left off, as you guys recovered from the encounter in the Trial Forge, and deciding on your plan going forward. Stepping from the tavern, having a few drinks, and discussing the merits of your current path, what would you like to do, friends?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Old dude hit hard.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Well done, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, we found two of the vestibules of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did you find again? Brass knuckles of some sort?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, no. He mentioned, he mentioned Titanstone Knuckles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know about those?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. It's a bit of a sensitive subject. (clears throat) I think my Uncle Kevdak has 'em.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. The leader of our wandering herd? He has two prize weapons that he pretty much used to use to beat me, like, near death.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And now we have them?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we, he's still got them.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So where, do you have any idea where they might be wandering?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's this thing, I lost the GPS tracker on them, so, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sometimes it gets there, well, 20 minutes here or there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but he's real strong. And it's only one of two really powerful weapons he has, so hey, at least we know where one of them is.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How is your relationship with him now? Besides the fact that he used to beat the crap out of you when you were younger.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just peachy. Like.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really great, no, it's fucking terrible.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh. That's lovely.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where are these leathers, then? From the Raven Queen, we need to figure out where the Marrowglade Loch is?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: The Marrowglade Loch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we know where that is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a lake.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I did get a map from the Slayer's Take, is there anything on this map that would indicate where the Loch is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the Marrowglade Loch resides about a seven- to eight-hour journey swift of foot to the west-southwest area of Vasselheim. And it is marked on the map, it's not marked as a major place, it's just this sunken, somewhat muddy, swampish land. You've passed--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: This wasn't the place that we passed on the way to go get Rimefang, was it? There was--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no no no. That was more north. But you passed this in your travels and some of your hunts with the Slayers' Take before, but it's never been a place of consequence, it is just a lake that exists on a map until this significance was given to it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So we, so Kash and I have passed it before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I'd say probably some time in the past.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we know it's relatively close, we should probably head there.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: If you think your uncle's closer than eight hours away--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, he's on another continent.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Then he's probably not closer than eight hours away.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Or he's in the tavern down the street. You never know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we need to, we told--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We keep changing places and nobody's going to know where we are. Pike is in Whitestone. How do we let her know we're moving? Or are we coming back here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, where are we going? Marrowway Cove? What?

lines.name: MARY, LAURA
lines.text: To the Loch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we're only going for a day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That dragon's days are numbered.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I feel like if Pike really needed to get a hold of us, she could.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could also leave word for where we're going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's leave word at the Slayer's Take that we're heading out. So if, you know, Allura or Pike shows up wanting to find us--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or, god forbid, if something happens to us, they know where to retrieve our bodies.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: The Take's not coming out to retrieve our bodies.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, they won't.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: The Take's not coming out. There's no money in your bodies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Kima at this point looks about and says, "Well, if we have plans to head east and probably "not spend much time here among Vasselheim for a while, I have some business I've got to clear up "here as well."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I introduce myself, Lady Kima? I don't think we've ever met before. Have we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She bears armor that is gold with various silver and blue details on it that are parts of the presentation of Bahamut and the temple that is a representation of his worship. She carries a large, metallic hammer that she keeps left over one shoulder. She has just-past-her-shoulders wavy ashy, dirty-blondish hair and a big scar that rides across her face as well as a number of other scars that aren't quite as visible. She grins as she steps up and moves her hammer to the other side of her shoulders with a clink and puts her hand out.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I put mine out as well and say: your appearance fascinates me on so many levels, I look forward to getting to know you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She pulls her hand away and she goes, "Interesting coming from you, definitely."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I don't think we met either, how you doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anyway."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's Kash. A man of few words.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've met few as unremarkable as you in my travels."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'm sorry, I wasn't listening, what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Touché. Well, I'll get about my business here, you said you're traveling for half a day to "a day, say meet back at the Slayer's Take in about 24, 36 hours, then head on to the east?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we assuming it's going to be as easy as all that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, wait, a couple days and then we're heading out? I thought we were heading out now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Or meet up with you, I'm going by what you're telling me. We can meet up whenever you'd like."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you coming with us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm coming with you, yeah, but I have some business to take care of here in the city before "we go ahead and head off."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. Can we wait a day?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To have Kima with us, I think so, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you guys are going-- where?"

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We were going to head to the Loch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To the Loch.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What do you have to do in Vasselheim first?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, good question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She crosses her hands for a second and says, "Why are you so interested in my business, "human?"

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Well, because if you're coming with us, then we have to wait, so what you're deciding to do very much affects what we're doing. So let me ask it a different way: what business do you have in Vasselheim?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He just raised his voice a little, that was the difference.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't catch that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I was trying to arrange passage to the east. Got a little bit of pull here in the city, "some favors that're owed to me, I figured maybe I could do a favor, but that's, I don't know. If "you're going to have an attitude about it."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Well then we're in trouble, I have an attitude about everything.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Pay him no mind, it's not personal. Kash.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What? I'm just, it's a logical question, see, she's got something to do in Vasselheim, we have to wait, what does she have to do? I don't feel like I'm talking out of turn.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Making friends as always.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To be fair, Kima and I had a rough start, too. She's, I mean, I love you, Kima, but I mean sometimes, you can get a little bit of, there's--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are we meeting back in a couple days or are we waiting, what's the business here, I--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How long do you need to get what you have done? You need a day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm assuming a day, I have to try and find a couple of folks and pull some strings."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need me to stay with you? To help you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No I'm fine. I've seen plenty of your strengths in the past."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And nipples.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We're missing something, I don't understand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we're missing something, wait, you're trying to get us passage to the back--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You're trying to get us passage to the Knuckles place, is that, get them passage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or are you trying to get us to the lake? I'm so confused. This is out of character, I literally don't have an idea what's going on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Little rusty after three weeks, folks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So I figure that's the passage we need to get "over there."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: When you mean east, you mean like, far east.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Eeeeast."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like really, okay. Well, no, there's time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here's the thing. Also, our lady Keyleth, the beautiful princess that lives among us, she has a way she can travel us very very quickly through trees, so we don't actually need passage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Through trees."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a new skill I've picked up since we hung out last.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's weird."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it's really quite painless. It's pretty cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's, yeah, and it has a nice cedar scent when you go through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So unless we're getting supplies and we need to travel with a lot of things, then, you know, we don't actually need passage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah, there's like 37 things we have to do before, so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need to carve out a plan, Kash is right, we should pick something short-term and do something because--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's head to the Loch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Loch is on the way to the Fire Ashari anyway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think that this is going to lead to some serious fighting? Because it sounds like these Vestiges are well-guarded.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, you don't have any reason to think that. Could be hanging from a tree branch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sure. You know what, Grog, that's an excellent point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Just hiding in plain sight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hanging on a tree branch under the lake.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's where I'd hide it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Z, Kash, you all have been by the Loch before, would you know what--

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It was pretty unremarkable last time we were there if it's the one I'm thinking of.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Actually, I may have remembered something about the Loch? What do I, would I have remembered anything at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What do I do for that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Roll a 20 and add it to your history. So 11.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 11. Is that an eight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a pretty unremarkable Loch.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's a pretty unremarkable Loch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as lakes go, it's maybe a few hundred feet across. It's more from a part of the land mass actually having a large sinkhole and where certain things may have existed, and there are bits of ruin throughout the surroundings of some sort of a structure that existed there, but most of it seems to have been swallowed up by the ground and the lake has formed in its place, though this was quite some time ago. And it swells or drains based on how much snowfall there has been in recent seasons, and it's been a pretty heavy winter for you guys, so you imagine from the times you've seen it that it's been pretty high, if not frozen over at times.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So it's rather unremarkable, but I think it's something that we can handle, definitely, within a 24-hour period.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we just loaded up on a bunch of potions. Some dickhead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am with Vex, though, I have a feeling that the chance that this item has been completely forgotten is not likely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we need allies and we need power because we're not in shape to take care of a coven of dragons at the moment. Seems like slightly lower-hanging fruit than the other option?

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Let's try it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What time of day is it right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this time, it's probably, say, midafternoon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we're not going to get there before dark, so maybe we should sleep here tonight and start out in the morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I have a question, and not like I can really help with this, but should we go see if we can read about some article of shadow-death, whatever the fuck it's called? Like, is it in a library?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe the Slayer's Take knows more about the lake, about these Vest-- no, these are pretty secret, I think the Vestiges are a pretty well-kept secret, people aren't going to just know where they are.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No? Like what if they're super-old but they go by a different name or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if somebody knows about a cavern under the lake.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what I would assume, is there must be some sort of underground structure, some part of the ruins.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or maybe we need to breathe under-fricking-water.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I've got two vials of that shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't we take the rest of the night to try and do some research. Is there any way we can find maybe maps or something about ancient history books?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And I do have a map from the Slayer's Take that I could--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, no, but I mean, we need to find like books about civilizations that might've been here in the past that might get us some sort of-- Like a library. Is there a library?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pictures or no pictures?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There might be some pictures.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. I'm in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a library nearby?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Oh, it's been two weeks and I missed you guys.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Do we have a library at the Take?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hm? There are a collection of books at the Take, but most of them are in reference to cataloging various creatures, details about their lifestyles, their inherent weaknesses, what elements of their bodies can be harvested and what clients are usually looking for. It's more specific to the business of the Slayer's Take than anything that would involve local history. I mean, I'll say if two of you would like to make an investigation check between the two, your choice, whoever wants to do that, we'll base, see what information you can find.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel good about my investigation, I have a keen eye.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got a pretty decent investigation. You and me, brother.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. 23.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not as good, but pretty good. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. In taking the better part of the rest of the day and asking around, you manage to find one location that carries books, and what you would consider as sort of like a library, though nothing of the ancient historical fashion. There are many books about the history of the temples here in the town, elements of the battles of old, but they're all very vague in their writing as almost like a story as opposed to a historical fact-gathering-type presentation. You manage to find a place that does deal in dusty books, partially repaired and restored books, a little bit pricier, but there is one tome that seems to talk specifically about the history of the Raven Queen's rise here in the city, and if you would like to possibly take this book, for a price, that is up to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is somebody watching me at the moment?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have I rejoined her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys are doing this separately.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we just perusing a bookstore, or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially right now you are, it's a small place, but there are two employees, and it's not very busy at all, you're the only person in the room, so they're both just quietly watching from a distance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I sit down on the ground and start reading through the book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Barnes and Noble-style?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And see if I can find information.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, about 30 seconds into that, one of the employees comes up and goes, "Excuse me, miss--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, hi!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you are going to--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I keep reading.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would ask if you would wish to read this to purchase it, as that is our business, we are "not an open place to just utilize the information."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I thought this was a library!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Or leave?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, well, can I just check and make sure that it's actually got any information that I need? Because if it doesn't then I don't want to buy it. You understand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You may peruse for but a moment. If you do not find an essence of what you're seeking at that "time, I would have to ask you to leave."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, of course, yes. Are you just going to stand there and watch me peruse then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I just start looking for what I need.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the brief time that you have going through, you manage to glean, there is a chapter that speaks of the Divergence, it speaks of the last large struggle that happened in the center of civilization. This was the second battle before the gods themselves fully rescinded from the land itself. And the Raven Queen did have a number of chosen champions as a part of this endeavor, and that's as far as you get before he goes, "All right, so, you've had a bit of time."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just don't know, I can't really tell if it actually has anything interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a tag on the book that says 30 gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's so dusty, though, I mean is that even worth it if it's this dusty? 30 gold? Does it have spells in it? No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He reaches out and grabs the book and says, "If you are not a serious collector, I'm sorry, "then it seems that we--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he starts pulling it, tugging it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! I hold onto it. Well, I know people that, you know, care about dirty old books, so I guess, I mean, I might be willing to purchase it for them, but they usually like things in mint condition when they buy their antiques. This has a damaged spine, I see it, and yellowing of the pages. And it seems like somebody's bookmarked this one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It wasn't kept in its neoprene sleeve.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He slams the book shut as you're perusing through the pages. "30 gold, or I will ask you to "leave."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. This is the worst haggling ever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get out your buyer's guide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's your name? (groaning)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just kill him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, good grief.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have robbed cadavers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as you're concerned right now, my name is No Sale." And pulls the book back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel hurt, and I pull out 30 gold and I say, I suppose-- (weakly) I'll buy it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes the gold, hands you the tome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it! It hurts! It hurts me in my soul.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the first time I've ever seen Vex pay full price for anything.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is that the first time you've ever paid full price for anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is, actually. The first time.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Momentous occasion. Hunter's Mark that son of a bitch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I kind of respect you. I'm a little impressed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Benjamin Cole, should you find your way around here again and wish to pay full price for "another one of our fine books."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Benjamin Cole. You're a dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Come again," he says begrudgingly as you exit the facility. So, looking through the book, it does talk about-- specifically, there are a few champions. Many that were lost entirely to the battle, unrecovered. One of the highest of the Order of the Raven Queen, that fought in her name, was named Purvan--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (cackles) Yeah, he was.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Perv on?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Purvan. P-U-R-V-A-N.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're running out of good names, aren't we? We've finally gotten to the end of your list of good names.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (giggling) Purvan Pedobear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not on the anniversary, Matt! Not on the anniversary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, this is great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (giggling) Purvan Pedobear.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Kash and Z were left staring at the bodies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (with great emphasis) Purvan--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, yes, get your perv on! Emphatically.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That's more hit points onto these guys here, for later. All right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Perv on, MacDuff. Perv on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Purvan Suul is the full name, though the name was given to the Raven Queen at the time of signing itself to the order, in which they become nameless. The champions are just mentioned or spoken of in public as The Champion, so the name is part of the gift they give to the Raven Queen when they swear themselves to her. Fell in the final conflict and was interred within a tomb to the west of Vasselheim. It is said that it is a multi-leveled tomb, and as the Raven Queen's fellowship began to fall out of favor after the Divergence had happened-- essentially, because her realm is death, during times of great conflict and strife, there is great power and a lot of energy given towards the Raven Queen. When things fall into peace time, or at least, for an extended period of time, there isn't a lot of conflict or burgeoning death and destruction within the vicinity, her worship tends to dwindle. As that dwindled, there wasn't enough people within the remaining bloodlines to maintain the tomb. It fell into disuse and since then has not been tended to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, nobody's there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's definitely going to be ghosts there. Kashaw?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do your holy shit when we go there, all right?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I will absolutely do my holy shit. You don't want to see the god, but we'll do the rest of the holy shit. We'll be fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really? Is it not, like, Sarenrae? Sarenrae? Is that your god?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, he's married, remember?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're married to a god?! Wait, you're married and you--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. We didn't have that conversation with her.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah, we didn't. For the record, she married me, and there's a difference.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're married?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Technically.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know if that holds up in court, Vesh.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: But yes! We can do a whole lot of stuff to get through the ghosts.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good times.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We'll just stay away from her. They weren't good times.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to hear more about this.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You really don't. You won't sleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So we also need maps, right? We need your maps.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes, I've got maps.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, don't you have something for me, also?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So I did. I brought it. And I give this to you, my friend. I'm very excited.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How big is it? I know I'm looking at it, but what does it look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and explain.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, go right ahead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a fine, smooth, dark metal warhammer that as the handle itself leads towards the heavy head portion of the hammer, the metal turns instead to almost a glistening ivory that has symbols pushed into it. A language you don't understand, but there's a giant moon crescent carved into each side of the hammer's head.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It took me weeks to forge it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is beautiful. Can I hit something with it?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What can I hit with it?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Scanlan, where are you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanlan, come here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's up? What do you need?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just stand right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Whatever you need.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach back halfway and give a quarter-measure (whoomp). Right into Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an attack roll. We'll say with disadvantage because you were taking a half-measure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: About the same as the Firebrand-ish?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's technically non-magical.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. You manage to just barely, as you see this thing coming towards you, and duck beneath it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought you were going to tell me a dirty joke, or something! When you say "come here," usually that's what that means!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I wanted to try out the hammer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Well then, no! Try it on Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm already 20 paces away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vax?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll stealth. Roll a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vax! Shit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Try as you might to look around, Vax is nowhere to be seen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I literally just pivoted around my sister and pressed against her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Doing exactly what she does?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to use Minor Illusion to make a really shitty Vax. A really cruddy-looking Vax.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not in Vasselheim!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit. Too late.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Too late. So as you're looking around, you see this strange quiver of shadow that seems to formulate in the air, and this awkward, still, unmoving, awkward mannequin-type visual recreation of Vax muddles itself there. I need you to roll an insight check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (laughs) Please be low.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Finally! Vax cannot evade your vision this time, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You stand right there. I swing down in an arc to try and hit Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. With this weird, awkward half-grin frozen in place. The hammer streaks down through this form and passes completely through it, slamming into the mud beneath, splattering mud up and around you, across your chest, and for a brief instant, Vax completely seems to have evaded the attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (yelps) I killed him! He's all over me! His bits are all over me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, how could you?! My brother!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What did you give me?!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's a hell of a hammer, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, the illusion is dissipated and Vax is no longer there before you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (screams) (weakly) I've killed him. I've killed poor Vax.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Come here, darling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is this evil monstrosity?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No. Come here. I lead him around the side of Vex.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, big guy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're alive! Come here! And give him a big ol' squeeze. And I squeeze a little tighter to make sure he doesn't turn into mud. You turned into mud last time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The harder he squeezes you, you fear you may turn into mud.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did it hurt? Did the Moon Hammer hurt you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. No, I was able to dodge both ways apart, and then came back together. It's my cloak does that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit, this is like-- we're going to save this for the really nasty fellas. All right, I'm going to put this in the bag.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, if a kid or Scanlan or Pike sees it? She'll be so furious.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah, she'll be terrified.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put it in the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. At this point, Kima has pulled a small flask out and takes a swig and goes, (sighs) "Ah, I've missed you."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Can you give me a swig of that? Come on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Best friends forever. (gasps)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (grunts, splutters) Respect.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So. Are we resting, or are we off? I'm growing impatient."

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: We're off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to go. We're going to camp overnight, yeah?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Sounds perfectly safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It doesn't matter if it's going to be daylight if we're underground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. All right. I just think, outside of Vasselheim, you know, things come out at night, but whatever.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We've killed a lot of them.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah, we have.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you guys think this is the most brilliant decision, I'm on board.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm actually hoping that it's the worst decision we make, because then everything's uphill.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So much wisdom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. I'm just trying to bring--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do it. We're out.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Having passed the loch before, would we have an idea of what we might anticipate on the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are bandits that come from the far west, possibly from across that sea that occasionally try and kill and pillage as best they can. Most everyone avoids the city of Vasselheim, because that place is pretty hardcore by comparison. So yeah, all kinds of things you could find.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah, I'm ready.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth, can't you turn us all to mist, and then we poof there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, do you want to Mist Walk this? It would be appropriate this time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then we could be there before the evening.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we control the direction that we move?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you Mist Walk us all, including Trinket?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Context is everything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Better double-check that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me see how many people I can do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far away is it? Ish?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At a fast pace on foot, it would take you seven to eight hours.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I know a place where we can get horses, as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Horses would die out there.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Might need food, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have a great history of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Killing horses?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I say we let Keyleth handle it. We swish out and camp for the night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go. Just do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Up to ten willing creatures for Wind Walk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay! Let's do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARY, LAURA
lines.text: (ghost noises)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We're like a giant fart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For some of you, it's a familiar, if still uncomfortable, physical feeling as your body--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just accept it.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What's happening?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just accept it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You become this amorphous, cloudy, vaporous form. You can fly at a very swift speed, even against a relatively strong wind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We probably should have talked out our plan before we did this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket in his mist form is seemingly very uncomfortable with this circumstance.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I use Beast Speech. Are you all right? Are you all right, Trinket? Everything okay? I can speak to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's happening?"

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's all right, darling. We're going to a loch. It's going to be great fishing for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will follow."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can talk in mist form?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, I don't give a shit.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Your fun is wrong. Your fun is wrong!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Your fun is wrong.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The t-shirt exists.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It does. Thanks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can imagine as part of the enchantment, as you guys can pass wind through your mist vocal cords.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Just about everything. He's very good at passing wind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, he's delightful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You really should just chain up with me and I'll get us there super quick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys begin to head westward, following your previous experience at the direction that it takes you. You push that way. Kima is also still getting used to this whole mist form endeavor. It takes a little bit for you guys to adjust to this locomotion, but it is very swift in comparison to moving on foot. Drifting over the top of the forest canopies, you guys, riding the top in this full-on, Falcor fly-through moment as you're cruising through the snow-capped forest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like E.T.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are certain areas where the canopy itself breaks apart, and you can see ravines, you can see where areas of the topography have cracked or shifted in time, and there are drops that go deep under the earth, though you cannot quite see where they would continue to go, until you make your way to the Marrowglade, and there you can see, still full to the top, if a little icy at the surface, it seems relatively undisturbed. You make your way, all drifting down, back beneath the canopy of the Vesper Timberland, and at the edges of the lake.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Are there any islands in the loch? Are there any islands or any sort of rocks or outcroppings, or anything within the loch itself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, actually. It's a pretty solid surface, and as you guys have drifted down in your form, looking at it, you can see that there is a layer of ice. You're not quite sure how thick, but the surface is very crystalline.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Any remnants of ruins around the loch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From above, could I see any sort of caverns or openings in the ground, or something that looked like caves? That's what I was keeping my eye out for as we went.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check for you, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Going to inspect them, and looking about them, there are pieces of fallen walls and what appear to be elements of the tomb, possibly before it fell within, but you do not see any sort of opening or entrance. It's just a part of some structure, some foundation that was left behind.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Are there any runes or any markings of any kind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 22 is what I rolled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22? Nothing near the loch. The largest chasm or portion of land that you saw that was broken and receded into the earth itself was probably about a half-mile to a mile back. Nothing that is in the immediate vicinity of this lake.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Is this technically-- are we in the woods? Is this my favored terrain again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You guys have come down into the forest. You're all still in mist form, so you're unable to directly interact with anything in the area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11? Doesn't seem to have any specific elements or markings.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I try, as well, because I can read any writing that we find? May I make a check, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check. Sure.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, that's terrible. Never mind!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you guys all rest around the outskirts of this lake.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we stop being like this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just think about it. Think about being a person again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How high are we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As high as you want to be. Right now, everyone has come down to the edge of the lake, so you're right off the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we turn like people again?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's turn like people again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell Trinket to turn like a bear.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Why is everyone talking like this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, can we talk normal? Oh.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Trinket, hon. Just concentrate on turning back into a bear, and you'll turn back into a bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell him I love him.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh! And Vex loves you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, the process is very strange as you see this misty cloud (poof) into a bear. It's about a minute for the full transformation. The spell still maintains its eight-hour time period, and you can transform back and forth during that eight-hour period.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Killer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we'll say it's been about three to four hours, so you're about half-duration. All of you eventually take a minute to revert back to your physical forms, and you're all now standing at the edge of the lake.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So for the next eight hours, with a little bit of concentration, we can jump back and forth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next four hours.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Next four hours. We can spend a minute to go (foomf) and (foomf)?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. You just can't do anything while you're in that form, other than move.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I remember.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Can you move underwater?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Can we mist underwater? Can farts travel underwater?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess if we get trapped underwater, we could just concentrate and turn into bubbles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's kind of cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right? That would work, theoretically.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Or we'll all drown.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or we'll drown.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's a freshwater loch, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. I walk up to the edge of the loch and I look in the water. What does the water look like?

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: It's ice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cracking noise)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's ice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he says that, you see a trickle of crimson streaking down the front of his head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Welcome!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to put some pressure on the ice with my foot. Is it giving, or is it not giving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the place where he put his head, or any other place?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm walking. I'm just testing the ice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Testing it with your foot on the edge, it doesn't seem to be any give. Looking up close, you can see it's probably a good inch and a half of ice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I go hit the place where Grog hit his head and see if I can crack a hole in the ice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It takes you a few minutes, but you manage to break apart and make a head-sized hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And how thick is it, based on what she just did?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about an inch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, just an inch. Ooh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is going to suck! And I put my head underwater to see if I can look around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check with disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's good, though!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, with disadvantage. Doesn't it count as disadvantage by destroying the rest of my dice?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perception. That is a 31? No, 41.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see through reality!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Giant floating baby right outside of the planet, in space.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. Glancing through the murky water beneath the ice's surface, it is dark, and what little bit of light that would be hitting the surface is refracting through the ice, so it's very hard to get a form. You can see there's a very thick layer of bottom-of-the-lake undergrowth: various underwater plants that have caked the entire floor area of the lake. However, you can just see, at the edge of your vision before the rest of the light is swallowed by the water and the murkiness of the depths, you can see what looks to be the edge of some sort of stone structure, where two walls would be joined, but they break off and crumble and disappear into more of the undergrowth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps, coughs) It's down there. Oh, it's so cold!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take her braid and I start wringing it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My poor little feathers are like, poo.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I use my staff to cast Light and shove it down in to see if we can get any light out of it, beneath the ice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. You cast Light at the end of your staff. It glows and illuminates and as you shove it down, the light disperses beneath the ice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take my mask and put it on, and use the glass to create a clear view into the water.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Should give you some light, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so having to close one eye separately, as the light source is literally right in your face, you do look past, using the air trapped in the mask. A little bit of water is peeking in because it's not perfect. You do manage to see beyond that yes, there is indeed an element. It looks almost like a slightly tilted peak of some sort of structure that comes to a point, and the top of the point is broken off and crumbled, and there are a couple of sections of stone that seem to offshoot at four different points towards the very bottom of the lake itself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How deep does it look?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it's about 50 to 60 feet deep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 50 to 60 feet deep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Good, good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Give or take.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to try to cloud-creep our way in there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far away is it under the ice?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: About 30 to 50 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's stand over top of where it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there any way-- because I have this horrible feeling that we're going to get underwater, and then we won't be able to get out because it's covered in ice. Can we melt the ice? Can you do something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was about to do that, yeah, but I want to go over-- Right above it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's a perfect idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Walk carefully.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we all going in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we should.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the same day as the monk fight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We didn't rest?! We're idiots.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But we were going to camp when we got here, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about dusk now, if you guys are landing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's camp-- oh, god.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So we're going to take a rest. What if I--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can at least start setting up in the meantime.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So if we rest, will it be a long rest? Overnight?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we're going to camp for the night. I don't think we should--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But our mist form will dissipate, so if we want to mist it, we should mist it now and check it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try to mist down and just see if I can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going with her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have Water Breathing. We could do that, too.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Or we could Polymorph and do something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, let's just use the magic you already expended first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull out your brand new hammer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, the Moon Hammer!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (doosh, doosh) Ice shards flying off, splashing in the water. You're covered in this ice-cold water now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm concentrating on making myself a fart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex turns into a large, gaseous form.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's doing it, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the two twins, (foomf) together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Twin farts.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'd also like to use Sculptor of Flesh and Polymorph myself into a very large alligator.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And go down and check it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys, all three of you, descend into the open portion of the lake that Grog has broken through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we go in as gas?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we breathe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys do. It's a slog, and you can move slowly, but the speed that's normally granted to you by this-- you actually move slower in this form underwater than you would normally, swimming, and as you submerge yourselves, you realize, even in this form, air is required, and you start (straining noises).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go back up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The forms-- it's almost like mist appearing on the edge of the lake that (fwoosh) forms up into your two different forms.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So pretty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, however, still delve down as your alligator, and you swim your way down across the bottom of the lake.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy, we did some science! That didn't work.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Congratulations. That's good to know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, if we rest, I can learn Water Breathing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, killer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Our good old Zahra is already down there looking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's try to set up camp in the trees, so we're not on the ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, like in Whitestone.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: As they're setting up camp, Kash doesn't leave the side of the lake. He's just watching for where Z went in. He's just staring the whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you guys are setting up camp in a similar way that you did in Whitestone, up within the actual tree canopy itself, I need you to make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Any sign of her, Kash?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Nothing yet.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you check around the ruins, looking about, you can see there appears to be two different entrances that are both completely caved in. What you do see, though, is there's an area of the bottom of the lake, about ten feet away from one of the edges of the temple itself, that there is no undergrowth. There's the muddy floor, but it appears as if there is no actual plant life that has grown in this ten-foot-circle area.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I investigate that area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mud.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's just mud. All right. Can I get down with my fabulous snout and dig down into the mud a little bit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take your snout and dig through the mud and bring up some clouds of dirt and whatever scum has congealed at the bottom of this pond. It murks up the water around you. Your vision is obscured. Doesn't seem to be revealing anything, per se.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: But I do see an entrance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see what would be an entrance to the structure, but the stonework itself has collapsed in on itself.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I see any writing? Any runes, any sign of carvings on the rocks at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What minor bits of design or grooves that were put into the stone to give it a presentational bump have eroded over time, but beyond that, it seems surprisingly plain.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What the hell would cause no plant life? And I can do no more investigating than just that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What else would you want to try and do?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (laughing) I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are welcome to do whatever you want to do while you're here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe Keyleth can find out something.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, then I'll go back up to the surface and report back what I saw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Right when she gets out, he throws his cloak over her.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And I transform back into myself and whack him on the butt as a thanks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With your tail?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: With my tail.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what tails are for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys return, and you relay what you found to the rest of the group as you guys are preparing yourselves. At this point, the sun has set, and the night itself is going from red to dark purple to a proper evening sky. Anything else you wish to prepare for the evening before you all find yourselves resting?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I undo the braid and I just -- starting over.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (yelps)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Anyone else?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I go speak to Keyleth about what I saw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I told everyone before, but I just don't know what it is, and I'm not quite sure how to go about finding out what's inside there. There's no plant life whatsoever, and you have a connection, do you not, to plants, to trees? A much stronger one than I certainly do, I would imagine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do. I could attempt to see what happened. What do you mean, there was no plant life?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And I tried to get down in with my snout, but all I did was kick up more silt, and I couldn't really see anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Strange. This was at the bottom of the ocean floor?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Of the loch, yes.

lines.name: LAURA, MARY
lines.text: The loch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check to see if that sounds like anything familiar and could be a problem?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go ahead and make a nature check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did it seem like a perfect circle, Zahra, or was it jaggedy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It wasn't mathematically perfect, but it was noticeable to be a section of the lake floor that was glaring to be missing in a large patch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How soft was the ground when you dug into it? It was softer than the rest of the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was very soft.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I just stuck my snout in it, and it kicked up all the mud, and I couldn't see anything after that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sounds to me like a creature that would burrow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's possible. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18? From what you understand, the reasons for something to not grow on the bottom of the lake would mean that the dirt and the surrounding earth would have to be disturbed enough to where nothing could take root.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It's a lair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I know of any creatures that are underwater--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That burrow? Giant worms?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it like the worms that we encountered before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you know and have researched about the worm you discovered previously, they tend to favor more rocky, mountainous terrain than underwater. There are many creatures that can burrow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any underwater serpents?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plenty of underwater serpents. There's all sorts of manner of creatures in this world.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's possible it's a creature that's burrowing, or it's possible that's an opening into our underwater cavern, and nothing can grow there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It could be a sinkhole. It could lead to--

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Could be a chimney.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Unlikely, but it could be a chimney.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Working for the Slayer's Take, and having done research on the animals that we have destroyed for money, would there be anything that we would know about serpents, or another creature that might inhabit this loch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whether it be a subterranean creature that uses it for passage, or if there's something that lives in the lake, or is part of the lake, living in the water itself, nothing comes to mind, from your experience.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's past sunset. It's now in proper night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me go take a look, real quick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going underwater now? It's freezing cold!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all going in there, anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can do my beast thing. I'll be fine. I jump in and go shark form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go to the edge of the loch and watch.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: So do I.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so the two of you are waiting at the edge of the loch? Keyleth jumps off the edge, and in midair, forms into this giant shark form that slams into the surface of the cold water through the opening that Grog had already opened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's really attractive now, isn't she? That shark.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm with Kash, man. What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Huh? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't do nature, or anything like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you inspecting the ruin? What do you want to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see if the hole is natural-made, or man-made?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a difference between your knowledge of nature vs. actually having to investigate a specific detail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. If you're looking at the area that she was mentioning, where the plant life is missing, it doesn't appear to be man-made, by any means. It just looks to have formed by some perpetual disturbance of the muddy earth in that vicinity.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sounds like a creature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you want to investigate while you're down there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does there appear to be any type of motion, or does it look like it's going downward, or is it just flat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has some variation to it, and there's a portion that appears to have been dug up, or at least, there is a slight indentation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me do a quick lap around the ruins and see if I see anything that jumps out at me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make another investigation check about the ruins, specifically.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. Looking about, same details that she made out about it. You do see there is one other stone entrance of the partially tilted stone structure. Looks almost like there was a double doorway there, at one side of it, but a series of stones and a portion of the structure have crumbled in on it, and it has blocked the passage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look to be a similar downward suction thing going on like the other hole? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like a partially collapsed, or completely collapsed entrance to this structure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: "Downward suction thing." (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the scientific term.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I bounce out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The shark (boosh) out of the water, catches you off for a second, almost Jaws-ride style.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Three point landing. Hi, guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fin, fin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, fin, fin. Land shark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Keyleth reverts to her normal form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm with Zahra. Seems like something scary is probably burrowing down there. We'll probably just have to avoid it tomorrow.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There are no other entrances. That could be the entrance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can unblock some of the blocked entrances. That's what we're going to have to do, is unblock the blocked entrance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's going to be a big day tomorrow. We should probably get some sleep.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: When I went around the ruins, did I notice how large the stones were that had fallen in for the blocked entrance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They varied in size, because it was part of the wall that had fallen in on itself, so there are sections that are three, three and a half feet in diameter, and there are also a number of smaller, head-sized rocks and chunks that had all filled in this space. A lot of the general soot and mud that had gathered as part of the lake's creation had filled in and covered elements of it and seeped in to form this pucker-point, if you will.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Pucker point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's getting weird tonight.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's an anus of the loch. The loch has an anus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should settle down to sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Scottish accent) Oh, you're going to Loch Anus, are you?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I did, as a crocodile.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Why are you making it weird? (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As we're settling down to sleep, I make sure that Trinket is laying between Kash and Keyleth, always.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just snuggle up with Trinket. Hey, bud.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Trinket, keep Keyleth warm. She's cold. She was in the water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: He's a big bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's a very big bear, and the moment that you glance over and give a look. Without even looking at you, you just hear this, (growls).

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay, fair enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Anything else you wish to prepare for the evening?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You all find yourselves asleep--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Who's watching?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you doing, man?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Then they all died in their sleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need to rest. You got beat up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We take fucking turns.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You go to sleep. I'm going to stay up for a little bit because I'm fine.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'll stay up with Vex.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wake me up when you're done with your shift.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, wake me up whenever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We climb up in the tree and keep watch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I find the only empty spot of fur on Trinket left and snuggle into it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The whole process of getting Trinket up into the tree itself is hilarious.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's difficult.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a difference between climbing a tree and getting up into a tree and then getting into a comfortable place where you can rest and not destroy the tree. It's a combination of minor druidic talents to create an element of the tree's growth that would be able to support a weight the size of a bear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I grow a basket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You've done it before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A bear basket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's very thankful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, the two of you keep watch for the first watch. We'll say for about a four-hour period. Okay. As the end of your watch progresses, I need you both to make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Each of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two that were taking watch. The twins.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He went to bed. I was awake.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We stayed up.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Because something's coming out of Loch Anus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A dark force is coming out of Loch Anus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's okay, I'm good. 34.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking off towards the other side of the lake, you see, under what little bit of moonlight is peeking through the cloud cover over the area, which breaks up every now and then. You can see a few stars glistening, and a little of the moon peeks through. Catches your attention, specifically, as the moon is the essence of your patron. Through your vision, you can see a handful of small-- I say small. Small from this distance, but relatively large, Trinket-sized furry entities that cluster up to the edge of the lake on the opposite side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket-sized furry entities? I can't see if they're actually bears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not at this distance, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're already stealthed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the circumference of the lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The full distance around it? I'd say 250 to 300 feet. It's not a huge lake.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a giant pond.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: So they're not that far away, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're about 50, 60 feet from you guys right now.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I have darkvision. Can I see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Darkvision up to a certain distance.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say, best you can look at it, you've encountered these in the past, and this appears to be a small group of evening-wandering owlbears that are passing through the vicinity.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Owlbears!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can talk to them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Big, angry bastards.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well why didn't you just say so?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They do not appear to notice your presence, and are just passing through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's just watch them.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What are they?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Throw things at them!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just sit and enjoy this magical moment of seeing the rare owlbear in person.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) So majestic.

lines.name: SAM
