lines.text: Quick! Start eating a Tootsie Pop.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: One.

lines.name: LAURA, MARY
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Three! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mr. Owl's bad, but Mr. Turtle was a real dick because he's the one who sent the kid to it, knowing full well the owl was going to eat that treat. The true villain's Mr. Turtle.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What about the education of the kid, where he's got to go to animals to learn things-- oh, forget it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Half the audience is going, "yeah." And half the audience is going, "what the fuck are they talking about?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get slightly nervous as the owlbears make their way closer to your edge of the lake, going to where the initial breaking of the ice was set by Grog. They all drink of the ice-cold water, and then eventually make their way scare on the opposite side of the forest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did they leave any feathers behind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A couple, maybe?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: After they get away, I want to climb down and gather the feathers that they left behind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find two owlbear feathers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We can put them in our hair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to fletch an arrow. Owlbear arrows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What kits do you have with you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit. Really? You know. Those ones I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a dexterity check. Just a straight dexterity check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where did you get those thieves' tools?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have thieves' tools because I'm a thief now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where did you get them? Did you buy them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I stole them, dude.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stole them from where? When? I don't remember that. Did that happen in-game, or did you make that up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 27. 27 dexterity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is asleep. Talking in his sleep.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Voice in my head. Brother. Twin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You finish out the rest of your watch. Using the moonlight at your disposal, you manage to make a couple of owlbear arrows with the feathers you found.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These are special.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're functional. They'll do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're fucking feathers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut up. I'm writing, "two owlbear arrows."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next watch?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys go to sleep. The two of you stay up. All right. You watch and the next four hours go by, unhindered.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I warn them there's owlbears in the area before I go to sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where? What the--

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: About three hours into their shift, can I come and relieve him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'll wait. I'll wait.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: De Rolo. How are you doing? A lot's going on. A lot. But it hasn't been that long.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm pleased for the distraction, honestly. I feel-- (sighs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has Orthax fully left the building?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't hear anything anymore, if that's what you're asking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think-- I think all I'm manifesting at this point is scars. Honestly, I feel a little lost now. I'm really not entirely sure what I'm doing with myself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I tell you, I believe you are a good man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you listen to your better angels, and they're within your friends. Listen to them. I don't want to be pushy. I'm sorry. But you have a family, if you want it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. I've been thinking, a lot, about why we're together and what we're doing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we all are, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And the conclusion that I've been coming to so far (sighs) and Pike being the exception to this rule, as she's the exception to so many things, is I think we're very broken people, but I think together, we are far greater than the sum of our parts. I like who we are together, and I think that's important.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I agree with that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I like the influence that everyone has on each other, and this includes, perhaps, you taking some strides with yourself. (sighs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How do you mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's good to want things. It's very, very good to want things. It's also very, very good to have things. It's good to-- it's good to find the things that are important to you and move towards them. I'm in a place where I'm realizing that I have to make decisions about what's important, and I'm a little envious that you seem to be ahead of the curve on that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wish I felt that way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well. I started talking to you. I just-- I'm sorry if I've done anything to offend you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're a bit of an awkward family, but we are trying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I apologize for any of the mistakes I've made, and honestly any of the mistakes I'm likely to make, but I am starting to imagine a better version of myself. I'm not quite sure who that is yet, but there is a destiny, I think, for us all together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is all a lot bigger than us individually now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've been given mighty deeds to accomplish. We will rise. Or if we fail, no one will ever know. (chuckles)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've said my piece.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The clinking of armor as Kima rolls over on one of the branches and is face-palming at the conversation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are really fucking cool. You know that, don't you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you hear a distant screech that echoes across the night sky. All of you wake up. While not extremely loud, it is very noticeable and cuts through the silence, as there is a very still wind tonight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Even if my sister's waking up, I kick her hard in the ass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah! Fuck you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You two, make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have we achieved our long rest yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have Pass Without a Trace cast on us--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you went to sleep, you didn't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are coming back to consciousness, you see a shape that's just-- can't make out the actual details of it, but it coasts across the distant sky, across the clouds, and a little bit of moonlight framing the image.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pull out Bad News and I'm just going to try and use the scope to trail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You pick it up and what you see in the distance is a very, very large bird, cresting across the distance. It doesn't appear to be coming in your direction, but it just slowly makes its way just over the opening in the canopy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am of course reminded of the giant roc. Is it the same shape?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty damn close. It disappears over the opposite side--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, is it our guy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He lived!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: After I've kicked her, I grab Keyleth by the shoulder and I start waking her up. Roc. Roc. Roc!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like the same one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does. You catch it just before it disappears over the distant horizon. It arcs away and then vanishes past.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) He made it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's very pretty, I don't understand what--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's the cow-roc. When we were cows! When we saved a roc.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was I? I don't think I was there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy was having-- you were having an episode. And locked yourself in the basement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, Percy.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Kash, it's the big bird.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I remember that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've seen it?

lines.name: MARY, WILL
lines.text: Of course, of course.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: When were you cows?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, it's a long story.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay, fair enough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We saved him, though, and we told him to come here!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We see him all the time. A fixture in the night sky.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was just a bird? I go back to sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you go back to sleep. You guys are finishing up your watch. Did you want to--?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'll take a watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'm out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So is it just Kash taking this next one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'll-- nope. (laughs) Do I need my sleep still?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you've had a full eight hours' rest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'll stay with you.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Good. We'll nap it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I elbow him. You're snoring a-fucking-gain--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shut the fuck up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So. I've seen you checking out some of the members of our little group, here.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: This is a very interesting group you have here, that's for sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen, Vax doesn't fly that way, I don't think. I know you've been eyeing him pretty good.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's not available for you.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What else do your keen eyes perceive?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's adorable.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That's funny. I didn't think anyone was going to pick up on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'm a romantic, so I notice these things.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You are that. You are that. He has a way about him, you have to admit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He does. He has a flair-- it's not my thing, obviously. I go for the lady hookers.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Well. To each his own, am I right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, yes, but no, you have good taste in men.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah. Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a dashing young rogue.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: He is. And this crew is lucky to have you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Yes. They are. They really are. That's your keen eye at work!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Well. We all see what we see, don't we? Incredible. Just-- incredible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I give you a bit of advice?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Please. Please do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, you have to follow your heart, so if you do have feelings for the lad, you at least have to tell him. Even if he won't return them to you.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It's funny, I've been wanting to have a conversation with him for quite a while now. We have a lot to discuss.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, what about?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Oh, you know, this and that. Feelings, as you would call them. Romance, as you would say.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You are so in touch with those.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I do my best. When you've lived the sheltered and wonderful life I have--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: TMI, my friend. TMI--

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That. Is funny. Well, you're right, we do have quite a bit to talk about.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we have another two and a half hours on this watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wake up. Can you guys talk a little quieter? Some of us are sleeping.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Are you going to be able to get her on board with my little plan for her brother?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think she just wants her brother to be happy, you know.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: And that's wonderful. How do you come up with your songs, by the way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well, you know. I think of like, a word, and then I try to think of a rhyme for it. Like, 'Kashaw', like, what could that be? That could be 'pshaw'! You know, something like that, I don't know, I'm working on that, I'm working on it.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That's amazing. It's a skill that I've never had before. But I guess as you said, when you really take in the world and can see people and how they feel, you can really write a powerful ballad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a man of the world, I'm well-traveled, I'm cultured--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (snorts awake) Rickshaw, rickshaw-- (snores)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here, I'll show you, I'll show you. I haven't a fear in the world!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (mutters incomprehensibly) (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sometimes it takes a while.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I don't. I don't understand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It takes a while.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (mumbles) Something rhymes with world.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: See? It's amazing. Every time. Every time.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Absolutely incredible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Through intense conversation and learning about one another, the sky comes to a glow with the rising sun.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: For the love of god, let something attack us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of the group finds themselves to consciousness. The cold morning air and frozen bits of early-morning dew across the grass and growth in the forest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hm, my ears feel really hot this morning, I don't know why that is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've been breathing on them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the little hole in the lake that we smashed? Is it still there, or did it freeze over?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hole's still there, but there is a very thin layer of what appears to be forming ice that could be easily cracked.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got it, I'll do that. And I go and take my morning wee right on the little hole where it's starting to freeze back over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Grog has now effectively peed in the Marrowglade Loch.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that's canon, folks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's the sound of 20,000 pens hitting paper.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: For the love of god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two weeks, folks. We've been storing this up. All right. So what's the plan, guys?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess we should breathe underwater and head down, right?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Can we handle the cold, is the question I want to know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is true. How cold is that lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're liable to get hypothermia if you spend any extended period of time in the water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Extended period.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Can we send somebody down to try to find the entrance and get in before the rest of us go down there and flounder around?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can, well. I have really good perception, so. I can go down and see if I can find an opening that you guys didn't see yesterday.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to take a walk around the whole thing and see if I can see anything on the edges.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How big-- you said the lake was like 350 feet--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a very, very large--

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I can destroy water, but I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can control water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you, like, make a, you know, parting of the Red Sea sort of thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might be able to, actually, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Try that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did a 22 perception check around the edge of the loch find anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing beyond the edge of the lake. There isn't, I mean, you find bits and pieces of broken stone, but nothing that seems to be indicative of a change in topography.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we have to escape, we don't want to necessarily rely on your consciousness.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can make us all look like fish.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good. Useful. That could be useful if something was attacking and they wouldn't attack fish.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, they're like, oh look, fish, I'm not going to eat that. I'm so bored of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll workshop that one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's good that you have it, but just hold onto it for a rainy day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can focus to part the waters for about ten minutes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten minutes? That's more than enough time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll run in, search around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You? We'll all run in!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll all run in, search around like maniacs for ten minutes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog, are you ready to dig?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then if we don't find anything, then I can still cast Breathe Water on us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much water can you displace?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A cube of up to 100 feet on a side, so you could pretty much part the entire lake.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it and run down and search.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: In doing so, could she get all the water out of the lake so that it would be gone forever, or is it just a temporary parting?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like that's killing a lot of wildlife.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there a lot of fish in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've been around. There are some fish that live in here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's just get in there. Let's not destroy the loch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I probably can't even get all of it out, but let me-- Let me see what I can do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you cast Control Water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess I cast Control Water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth, I have total faith in you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go, Keyleth. Go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Keyleth completes the spell in a rapid series of hand motions, concentrating, her eyes illuminate with the power of her druidic, divine energies. She extends her hands and the water itself in the center of the lake, the ice cracks up, almost like a fissure is building in the center. It's almost like tin foil being folded back from the inside out. The ice is actually breaking and being pulled to the sides, and as the ice is pulled back, the water is pulled back with it, like someone has torn into the surface of the earth and peeled the ice back like a sheet. It forms this long tunnel that leads directly down into the center of the lake. The water is being held aloft over the surface, not actually being cast to the sides out into the river. You could empty the lake, for the most part, if you wanted to do it now, but right now you're just holding it aloft as these two water pillars.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could you build an ice tunnel, perhaps? Take some of the ice and actually structure a--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, actually, I think as Control Water, I can also change if it freezes and if it's solid? Can I freeze the edges of this? Make an awesome--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot refreeze water with this spell, unfortunately. You can just control its shape. The temperature is a whole different ballgame.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But there is frozen-- we could take the existing ice and create--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what? I'm running in. And Keyleth, just be ready to throw it away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just going to focus and keep pushing it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I run in and start looking for anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go! Move fast, you have ten minutes!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I go to the entrance that was blocked and I investigate to see whether or not there's any way we can climb our way through. Focus on the non-vegetative spots and get in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to that and seeing if there's something there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The stonework-- you can start pulling the stones that block the area that lead into that one collapsed entrance, and yeah. You start moving things out of the way and they tumble down to the bottom and stick into the mud. The bottom of the pond is a very interesting sight when it's drained. All the plant life is just sucked together and you're all sloshing through. You're up to your knees with each step as you just sink into the mud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a super muddy "ahnus."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am going to go ahead and start pushing some of the water outwards, out of the lake as I'm keeping it pushed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go to the hole, to the "ahnus," and start looking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking in there, as you begin to step into the mud, it is a thicker portion and your feet begin to sink into it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can control water. Can you control the water in the mud?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got a lot on my mind right now, Percy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. Okay, I was just throwing it out there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To a certain extent, you can control elements of it, but because the earth itself is not part of it, it does resist the spell effect, so it would be very minimal effects. As you step into it, you begin to sink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I just stepped right in, because I'm really smart, you guys. Hold onto me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start pulling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, thank god I'm so strong. That is-- I'm going to use Luck, and that's shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going. I'm sinking. Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The two twins are now, (sucking sound) being pulled in into this small mire.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What happened to you two?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, help. Seriously, quick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Remember how happy you were that I was alive? That's not going to last much longer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on, come on. Grog, help!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How deep are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's about up to her waist now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah, you're good. Just swim.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Up to upper torso. Vax is now getting to right around upper thigh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, look. I mean, you're not even twinsies about it. You're at different lengths. You've got to even out a bit.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Don't struggle, or you'll sink faster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's all, (concerned grunts).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take out my Rope of Infinite Twine and throw it to Trinket's mouth from far away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chomp, grunt)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pull. Me. Out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and with that, Trinket begins to back up. (sucking footsteps) Can't get traction in the mud. He's trying to pull, but is sliding in space.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This sucks, you guys!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try to grab the rope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, why are you being a dick-fuck? I need to get out of this mud. Seriously?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ugh. That's a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no movement on this point. You guys are trying to pull and they're not sinking right at the moment. There is tension on the rope, but they're not being pulled out, either. They're just held in place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You all had better be making damn good use of this time!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great use, Keyleth. We found an entrance point. Ish.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we just at the edge of the pond?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are now in the center of the base of the pond.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we haven't gotten to the part--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys are at the base of the stone structure, which is not too far from the section they're sinking in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dying in slow motion over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've been pulling rocks away from the crumbled entrance, which is much easier now that there isn't water pressed against it, so you're actually moving rocks out of the way, and you're making some headway into this entrance.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do I even see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see out of the corner of your eye, them talking and shouting to each other.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Grog, come over here! Darling, I've got some rocks you can move. Maybe we can get in on this side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not going to even help? Cool.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can't see you. Corner of my eye. I hear you squabbling. You guys squabble all the time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now, what are we moving?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously, we're dying! We're going to die.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are sinking in the mud over here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kima runs up to you guys, looks over and goes, "Ah, they're fine," and starts grabbing rocks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here we go, let's move this shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, guys, you want a hand?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Please get us out with Bigby.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I will cast Bigby's Hand. And I will gently lift them up and cup them as I pull them up from the muck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Since we have Bigby's Hand, why don't we use it to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, sure, sure. What do you need me to lift?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you scoop out all the mud in that fucking hole that just tried to kill us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's scoop. We're scooping. I'm scooping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you scooping mud, or are you scooping stone? I didn't hear which one you're doing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I go with Zahra. What do you want me to scoop, Zahra?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, well, did I even hear any of this? I'm still over there with Grog, moving--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're moving rocks.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We're moving rocks. (louder) I think we're going to move rocks. Can you give us a hand with the rocks?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Here it comes. Whee!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughs) I'll say, the two of you guys make strength checks, and you go ahead and roll a d20 and add your charisma-- no, Bigby's Hand is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, that's your wisdom modifier. Holy cow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that good or bad?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's awful. That's amazing. I've never seen anything like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, plus eight to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, okay. 20 and?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four. So you're "helping."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'm more of a delegator.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But between Grog and Bigby's Hand, though, large sections of stone are being scooped out and tossed to the side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I start tossing water out of this lake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're a little past halfway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seeing that they're still doing a lot of work, I'm going to start seeing if I can push some of this water out of the lake a bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You push some of the water out of the way. Some of it is splashing off to the side and being soaked into the local dirt and earth. You're still holding about half of the pond itself up at the sides. You guys are beginning to make headway through, and you see a lot of the stones here have been pushed in with suction from the mud and kept a barrier, and about three minutes later, you begin to find an opening, and you start pulling out a big plug of stone, and you can see beyond that, there is an actual stairway, and a pitch-black, lightless entrance that goes deeper into this actual structure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, problem. Stairway, but when water comes back in, you drown in that stairway. So--

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We'll have to block it up behind us.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Once this is done, can you cast one of those--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe? I start walking towards them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Once we're in and water's covering it, we're not going to be able to get these stones away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth, can you walk down this way while still doing that, and Scanlan, can you use Bigby's Hand to block the hole once Keyleth is past you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For a very small amount of time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and then Keyleth, can you make a wall of stone once you've let down the water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, if we try and go super fast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can cast Light and get us down there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I can make a wall behind us or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go and start heading towards the tunnel and pushing all the water outwards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, concentrating, steps inside as the last one as you begin, with the last few minutes you have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess I'll just pack it with mud and rocks, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hand pulls in the last plug as the water (crashing water sound) comes crashing into itself, filling the space. As you all are standing there, the light of Zahra's staff lighting the area, there's the impact of water rushing in against the stonework, and you can feel the whole place shake from the impact, and immediately water begins to rush in through the cracks of this created section.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not a good builder! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold it, Scanlan, hold it for a moment!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was going to say, based on the push of the water against the rock and Bigby's Hand against that, I need you to go ahead and roll a d20 and add eight for Bigby's strength to try and hold the plug in place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24 total roll. With that impact, you can see streams of water pushing through and mud and other elements filling the gaps of the stonework, Bigby's Hand pushing up against it. Looks like the stonework was ready to give, and the water begins to go ahead and fill this vicinity, the hand pushes back until the streams that are peeking through turn to a trickle, and by the time the spell finally comes to an end, the hand vanishes, the plugged hole gives a little bit, and then seems to keep itself in place. Water's still dribbling out and trickling, there is still a gradual bit of moisture passing through here, and you don't know how long it'll hold, but for the time being, it seems to be holding.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yikes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Well done, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you for the idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we could risk it or-- Keyleth, are you able to put up a wall?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we can risk it for now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, risk it. Because we have to come back through this way, probably.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true, if something happens you can put it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's head downstairs, and we might not need to worry about this in a second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, sneaky-sneaky, go take a look.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you talking to her or me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, you, shitbrain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, you know what? We're not doing anything for you, you fuck, 'cause you didn't even try to help us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, look at me, digging in a muddy hole that led to nowhere.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: See that? My man's going to check some stuff out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah, you must be so proud.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Very excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll be right back, so get your snacks, get your bathroom on, we'll be here as soon as possible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get your Purvan.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Get your Purvan!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're all going to die. All of you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: [break]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations. I'm glad we have a little ways off before we have to worry about that. Or maybe Marvel will rekindle that comic series. But yeah, so, congratulations, BlackDeath2099. Also, a reminder to all of our European viewers, we here in the US, 'cause we're ridiculous and still do this whole timechange thing, we are springing forward, it's our Daylight Savings, so the show will actually be airing an hour earlier for you guys, which might be pretty good for you guys.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: So everyone can work on the farms.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. Which no one-- and it doesn't even work there.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Damn you, Benjamin Franklin.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What is today for Critical Role?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We were so rushed at the start, we didn't get around to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We didn't even talk about how it's our one-year anniversary--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's our one-year, it's been a rushed day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you get for a one-year anniversary? Is it paper?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Paper.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Happy anniversary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, I mean, thank you guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We get tons of fanart, that's paper.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is paper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you guys for kicking along with us for a year.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We got a very nice anniversary present from Megzilla. From Meg.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, it's so beautiful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's my background now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mine too! Is yours just you? 'Cause mine is just me and Pike!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Me and Pike, it's the only ones, 'cause it can't fit all of us, you have to try and frame it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's a unifying entity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, guys, wanted to let you know before we get started here again. You helped our good friend here Ivan, is doing his Kickstarter for the ABC's of RPG's, which is awesome, but one of the stretch goals was to actually have a few pages of Critical Role-related activities for kids within the book, and you guys succeeded in smashing through that stretch goal, so he gave me a couple of the early designs to show off. Here's the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can show it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So this'll be part of the presentation of that activity, which is fantastic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And this is artwork by Wendy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Put it on the thing, on the paper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the paper?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right on-- right, yeah. There you go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then we have here, we have the create tattoos for Grog activity sheet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes! Yes, I can draw all the penises I want on him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So there's that one there. And then here we have the Percy connect your knowledge of the various fantasy creatures activity book.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Baby, baby creatures!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'd like to point out, the rakshasa with the hands. It's doing jazz hands!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So those are the really cool art pieces you can look forward to, you guys kicked ass on making that happen and so we have our own little stamp in his amazing creative piece, so thank you for that. Look to that. There's also more stretch goals, I think, before it finishes up, so if you want to smash those records, feel free to check it out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Smash.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you for letting us be part of that, Ivan.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Grog smash with moon hammer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So. Now. As you guys-- bringing it back to the game, here. I think those are all the announcements I'm supposed to make there, perfect. Let me get set up here with some proper audio. I want to get some good atmosphere here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Imperial Death March?

lines.name: MARY, LAURA
lines.text: (sing Imperial March) (all warble Imperial March)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we Death Star chickens? What's happening?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That got weird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They just cut the power on our show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Are you guys all staying at the top of the stairs, or are you staying a little bit behind Vax's movement?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm 20 feet ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually, can I take a moment and use Primeval Awareness and sense if there's any undead entities around, any ghostly or undead zombies? Anything undead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I-- sorry. Rolled a 30 for perception.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aberrations?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which one are you focusing on? I think you have to choose the type.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's start with undead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Undead? You take a moment, focusing here--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Up to six miles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. As Vax pushes forward. Nothing catches your attention, undead-wise. There are no undead entities within the vicinity which you can focus on, so that's one thing you don't got to worry about.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One thing.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I think because Z is in the front with her light, Kash backs all the way up to the back and lights a light, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you hit the bottom and you look around, you see ahead, immediately across the way, as you're the first in there, two small humanoid shapes down this T-junction. To the right and left of you are two tunnels, and there is one ahead, and about 35 to 40 feet ahead of you, you see two humanoid individuals.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what they are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without a Trace on the group.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you kill them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to sit for a minute. One minute, and see what they do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we stealth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's all stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Everyone roll stealth. Are you keeping your light spells up?

lines.name: MARY, WILL
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you snuff the light spells, so you have zero visibility right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am really well-hidden.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I've got darkvision.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So do I.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stealth checks from everybody?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am covered in mud.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's true. We are really camouflaged.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The twins are dark right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a natural one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, add ten to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. With the plus ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. With the plus ten?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: No, then it's 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there any light here? Dim light?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no light.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We just doused it. Grog and I can see.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Darkvision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These two figures just walk beyond. What little bit you can see, and both of you guys roll perception checks, those with darkvision right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, wait. Darkvision?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Natural 20. Natural 20.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah! That's your second one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're humanoid. Bipedal-- two arms, two legs, standing up on their legs. However, their feet are these webbed claw-type physicality. They're wearing haphazard leather tunics, wrappings around their wrists, and they're hunched forward as they're walking away from you, deeper into the shadows. Seemingly completely unnoticing of your presence. Their heads are these bowed-forward fish-type visions. You can see they have these bulbous eyes at the edges, jagged, toothy mouths that end at this small point to the end. Very, very fish-like, amphibious-type entities. They both scuffle alongside each other and shuffle into the darkness beyond, down that further hallway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're walking in pitch black, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We have tunnels left and right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Left and right and in front, where they both disappeared.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We don't hear them speaking, we don't hear them doing anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they're just walking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they look to be on patrol? Are they walking back and forth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're just walking. They haven't turned back.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Are they armed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can see, both of them have what looks to be a cluster of ropes to one side, hanging off their belt, and have spears that they're clutching and walking along.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Are the ropes attached to the spears?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do they have eyeballs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They do.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What color are they? I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no color in darkvision. It's black and white.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Everyone listen up. There's two of them and they're walking away from us down a hall. They don't see us yet.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: They appear to be some sort of fish-like creature. They've got spears and ropes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what? I bet if they live in the dark, light will blind them.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You know? You're very smart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we all huddled together at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've all gathered down to the bottom--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They came up behind me, right? Yeah, so you're talking into your ear to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Guess what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What? What's going on?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's fish people up ahead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It sounded like that, but I can't see shit down here. Zahra, you were able to see?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I poke my head in between the twins and I go, do you guys have an earache? Does your ear hurt?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you see us? We can't see anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can't see shit, either.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we get some light?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Should we-- there's a tunnel to the left and there's a tunnel to the right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out my Flametongue Dagger and make dim light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as the dagger gives off a bit of flame, those of you with low-light vision have extended visual at this point. At this point, too, as you're adjusting to the atmosphere here, there is this very heavy smell of mold and mildew throughout this entire area, and looking down, you can see the bit of light dances across the stone floor that has water trickling across it and leading to one side, to the left, with the tilt of the floor. What do you wish to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we can follow the fish brothers, or we could check out these two tunnels.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a question. In my book that I bought for 30 gold, did it mention what level of the multi-level tomb the champion was buried on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, there wasn't much detail about the tomb's actual build. It spoke more of the history of the man who was buried there and gave reference to the direction you were traveling to, just to reaffirm you were going in the right way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got played.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got played. It was a worthless 30 gold, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you learned information about the history of the man who's buried here. It's not like every stone structure of ancient history has a book of blueprints available at your local 7-Eleven.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That was 60 gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's a little more expensive.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, Grog. Since you and I have darkvision-- Is it still-- did you cast Light?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you can see Vax is holding out his flame dagger. It has a little bit of fire trickling off it. It's ever-so-gently lighting the very local area.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'd like to investigate the tunnel to the left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I'll look at the one on the right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the left. You go to the one on the right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I tell Vax to stay on my six as I go up.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: And I follow Z.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So we have Grog and Vex are heading to the right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone else? Everyone else staying in the center?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Staying center.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll stay center with Percy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go with Zahra.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I've noticed that you all have some sort of earpiece. Do you have any extra?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but I'm going to go with you, so I'll be able to report.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Oh, great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, two of you stay behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kash, are you sure you don't want to go with Vax?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: No, I'm good. Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. Grog and Vax, you guys traverse to the right, with what little light he's giving off the dagger. It continues for about 15 feet before it curves sharply to the right. Roll a perception check, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have that darkvision, too. That's not bad. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A couple of stones (cracking noise) crumble--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stop. Stop, stop, stop. Get back. Back up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear them, after a number of seconds, eventually hit with a slight splash of water.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just think you should go in front of me here, is all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You think I should go-- you want me to scout ahead?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it looks a little slick, but just go ahead, just real careful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I walk past--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm kidding! Jesus, it falls off into eternity. It's instant death.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, you can't see?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I really can't get a bead on you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you guys keep it down? I can hear you from here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab my earring and I say, I'm on the right. It is a dead end all the way.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can you see down the hole?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a dead end? So it's a wall in front of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I grasp his giant fucking forearm and lean out with the dagger, and how far can I see with this dim light?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see that this collapsed portion goes for about 20, 25 feet, and then the path continues beyond that for about another 20, 25 feet, and then comes to a halt at the opposite side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So there's a big gap and then there's more path further.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's like 20 feet. Does anybody climb on anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you see any openings down there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're not here. You don't even know what we're doing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't you climb on shit?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can, but let's see what the others find on their end, and then we'll figure out if we want to deal with this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Hey, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What did you and Zahra find?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys continue down the other way-- (laughter)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Meanwhile--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Back at the ranch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys step down this surface, and the water is pouring down this way, and as you step, there's this squishing sound. Not from the water, but there is, every ten or so feet, there's a patch of very thick, mucus-y slime that seems to cover portions of the wall and portions of the floor. You slip a little bit and catch yourself, and there is a residue that you have to slough off your boots.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: This is never going to be good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, the tilted tunnel comes to a very tight spiral staircase that descends further down.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Scanlan, tell them I can see some sort of spiral staircase, but there seems to be a lot of goo here, and I'm always wary of goo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Goo is rarely good. We should continue on to find out.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I agree. Should we-- Do we check in with the others and see?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What are you holding your ear for?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is something we all do. I don't know why, we don't need to do this. It's just a thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like Professor X.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It might feel weird. (louder) Grog, can you hear me? Grog, can you hear me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, now I can hear you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, there's a spiral staircase and some snot. So we're going to keep going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, wait. You're going down into the snotty--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Talking to Grog!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's all go down into the spiral staircase.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I heard it, as well. We don't want to split up. Wait there for a minute.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there any moss-snot near Percy and I, in the middle of the hall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking about your general vicinity, very quickly. At your foot, yeah, there's some.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a check-- A snot check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That one failed me.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I blame the dice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's good. 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Taking the slickness of it, you were expecting some sort of secretion, and there is no acridness to it. There is nothing about it that seems to jump out at you as a natural creation by a creature. You're not quite sure what the source of it could be. It could be, somehow, over time, slickness that came in through the water, or some other source. You really, in your experience as a druid, have no clear idea as to where this may have come from.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's not from a creature, but it is natural?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't appear to be natural. The viscousness doesn't match anything you've encountered from nature, so you're not sure what the source is. It doesn't appear to be like a large snail or something like that. The only reason you would know that is from your experience with subterranean creatures, and studying that in your books, and as you go through what you've researched, nothing jumps out at you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've milked a lot of snails, and you've never seen anything like this.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (laughs) This is the strangest snail milk I've ever seen.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Does it have any aroma?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, actually. No aroma whatsoever. It is relatively featureless other than its viscous texture.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to pull a Grog and taste it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said there's no acridness?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Flavorless.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, guys. I don't trust this goo. It creeps me out. Just be careful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On our end, there's a big chasm over here, and there is a path on the other side of it, but we'd have to get over the chasm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we can manage that, if you think it's not a dead end.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But you've got a complete stairway over there with boogers on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we want to head down. Down is the way to go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've gone beyond your vision. You don't see them. The path just continues on in the direction they were walking. They have not noticed you and have not seemingly returned yet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a sentry, I just keep looking that way.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I think we should go down.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What do you think about a little bit of light?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can still see in the dark for a little while. Let's not alert anything of our presence.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of you are fumbling in complete darkness right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really fucking dark.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: When you cast Light, do you get to control the amount of light, or is it just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. I don't see why not.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. I'll cast Light and keep my staff behind me, a faint candlelight as I continue to use my darkvision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So do you guys return with the rest of the group, and the group continues down the spiral staircase?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to keep an eye out for any traps or anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I keep an eye on the goo.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll stay in the very back and leaving the Dust of Tracelessness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Trinket finally comes down the rest of the staircase, staying back from the rest of the group, being stealthy.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Trinket, have you ever experienced anything like this? Do you know anything about this gooey shite?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket is actually far behind. You'd have to back up to converse.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have quite a large group here, especially with Kima involved. You have quite the party. This is going to be very interesting to see how it--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all in the same tunnel now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are all making your way down the left tunnel, down the spiral staircase that Zahra found. So. You progress downward. You're looking for--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Traps. I'm looking for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just keeping an eye out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm using the light from her thumb or whatever.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: My staff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to look for any imperfections in the stairs that look like they could collapse at any time or they could be unsafe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys make perception checks with disadvantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very low light.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know why I rolled both at the same time. 22 for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 28 for me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a disadvantage roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Coursing down, what catches your eye is a little ways down the spiral staircase, there are a couple of small, dark, what look like minor objects that stand out against the rest of the stone structure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I crouch down and look at it and see what it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've been there for a while, but there are two feathers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they look like the owlbear feathers that I picked up earlier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, actually. Owlbear feathers are textured, with some layers of color, like a natural owl-type entity would have. These are jet black. You recognize it very quickly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Keyleth? Have you ever seen feathers like this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they appear to be raven feathers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are raven feathers, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why were they covered in goo?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe this was some sort of offering to the Raven Queen? We might be getting close.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck. The Raven Queen. Right, that makes sense.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Well done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you. You guys: ravens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ravens, yeah. Onward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pressing down the spiral staircase. It comes to another floor beneath the one you just hailed from. Go ahead and make another perception check, you guys going forward. It's the two of you at the front?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do you need more light? You all right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, was I supposed to still be at disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If she's behind you with a very faint bit of candlelight. You guys have low-light vision, so you can still make these checks right now, but it's at disadvantage because it's very, very limited.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: The twins, baby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you guys push forward, you reach out and stop Vax before he takes another step as you notice this pathway now, hatchbacking back in the direction you guys had come from on the lower floor. You can see these very, very thin, about two inch wide slits in the stone walls to each side of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to take a closer look at those things. Do I need to roll anything if I see them now, because she's pointed them out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She pointed them out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to try to disarm them. They look like things I've seen before. They look like traps. I'm going to try to disarm them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go for it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I extend my staff and I raise the light just a bit so you can see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like traps? You want to perceive them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is disarm traps? Dexterity check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be using your thieves' tools, and for this it would be-- I will make this an intellect check, with the tools.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: An intellect check? Not the thieves' tools?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thieves' tools, proficiency, plus your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus the intelligence modifier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, because this is-- you actually have not encountered this type of trap before, and you're trying to ascertain its nature without setting it off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I need popcorn for this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 23, then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, you're really smart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you step forward and begin to try, pulling your tools out to inspect the nature of these, looking into the dark paths on each side, there's an instantaneous movement, like a puff of air that comes out of each side. I need you to roll a dexterity save.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Instinctually, I do evasion, if it's dexterity. I rolled a 12 plus-- 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22? All right, you (zoomf) just out of the way as these two pendulum blades (whoosh) right past you, missing you by about a half an inch. And then (whoosh) disappear and then swing back a second time, resetting on opposite sides of the hallway.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We all saw that, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all saw that with a very (whoosh, whoosh).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scythes in the wall? My nose tickles right now. I'm going to attempt to take these out and-- hold on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I perceive around and see if I see any switches or anything that would turn them off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thieves' tools to disarm, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be more of trying to find a mechanism in which to disarm them, which she is currently doing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This wouldn't be Underdark-y at all, would it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then I rolled a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, this is an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Investigation? All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten? You have no idea of the nature of these.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this perspective, you have no inkling or idea as to what the mechanism is, where it's hidden, if there is a way to be able to disable the trigger. You have not encountered this before, and it is a little beyond your expertise at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog, there's giant scythes in the wall or something and I can't figure out how to take it apart. Do you have a weapon that you could jam in this fucker? Like a throwaway weapon that you don't care about?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I've got three greatswords that are shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to fucking fuck this knife hole with a sword?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On Vex's suggestion, I'm going to make an investigation check. 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, while you guys are having this conversation. Scanlan, you step directly up to the very edge of where these blades swing from.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I think someone has a crush!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you notice that, just glancing ever so slightly on the inside, there is some sort of a latch that is guarded by the blade's embedded portion. You realize as you put your hand forward, you trigger some sort of arcane sensor that is part of this that causes the blades to (whoosh) swing back, and as they swing past you, you hear a click on the inside of the groove that they swing from, and then as they swing a second time to reset, it gives a louder click sound, almost like it resets itself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And how long a period from the blade swinging, to swinging back. Like a half a second?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about a second. It's (whoosh, whoosh).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So someone needs to reach their little hand in there and click it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Someone with little gnome hands, maybe.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Impress me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, watch this, y'alls. I'm going to try to do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, would you like a little bit of-- enhancement?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Enhancement?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural enhancement, of course.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, I will never say no to enhancement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I reach over and I enhance-- what are you probably going to be using, dexterity?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess a little shortsword-y blade, I guess, to get in there? Or I have--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this going to be a sleight of hand check?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have climbing gear, I have a cube. I have a flute. What can fit in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about two inches wide, the gap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's wide enough for your fingers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Enhance Ability and give him Cat's Grace for his dexterity checks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you have advantage on dexterity-based ability checks, currently.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on. I need these babies to play.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't lose your hand, Scanlan. We don't have Pike to regenerate it right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have any tools I can borrow?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a sword.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That shitty sword that you don't care about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a very nice sword that I care about quite a bit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could I shove a blade in there and jam it, maybe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try to.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That's never a good answer. (laughs) You can try.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shortsword, or whatever it is. I have never used it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (muffled) Don't use that sword. What are you thinking?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'm going to jam it in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to do it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have advantage on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, plus my dexterity, which is zero. So that's 13.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dear god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once you understand the nature of this, it's not a very difficult thing to find. You bring the blade around in that brief moment, and as you bring your head into view to inspect the inside, you can see there is a slight stone protrusion from within that groove. You realize the blade probably isn't going to help at this point. You reach over and just (tkch).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With my finger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Locked in place, as the arcane nature of this trap has held them aloft.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That was hot. That was very hot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was your first roll?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) That would have been very bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you for the advantage, Keyleth.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That was impressive. If it weren't for Vax, you'd be my man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm in the middle of this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry, everyone! I've cleared the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you guys continue forward down this long hallway, heading at a slight upward angle now, going against the tilt of this temple. Who's leading? All right. Pushing forward, it continues for about 60 feet. There was a tunnel split over to the right side, but that has entirely collapsed and is just filled with stone and it spills out partially into the hallway, but it's easy to step over and get past. Eventually--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you saying it's not blocked, it's just some rubble and you can step over it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Meaning the passage that you're walking down, it looks like there was a path that went to the right. That whole thing collapsed inward and is completely impassable.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's pooped into the passage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has spilled into the passage, but it's nothing you can't traverse over.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Wow, you paint with words.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His vernacular is impressive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: "It pooped into the passage."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing even further forward, the passageway begins to curve gradually to the left over about 20 feet, and disappearing around a corner. As you continue to push forward here, you have moved beyond the light, unless Zahra, are you keeping the same essence of light here to help with his vision, you would have to travel up with him to be able to see around the corner as you move.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vex, could you tell Zahra to come up another 20 feet or so?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Coming. Coming now. So I go up and I stand next to him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Walk quietly, dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Across the way, the tunnel directly across from you comes to a halt. It just ends about 20 feet beyond this intersection. There is a path to the right and the left. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You can see, in a similar fashion to the tunnel you and Grog first discovered, the floor that is the center of this T-intersection has completely fallen out, as well. There are sections of stone that jut out from the edges, but it appears that this intersection for about a ten by ten foot area of the floor is just completely bottomed out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I had a fucked-up passage on the right behind me. I've got a T ahead of me that goes in two directions, but there's a hole in the middle of the T.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there's nothing else?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing else visible in the area.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: How far are they sticking out from the stone walls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You aren't with them.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Oh. That's a good point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I back up against Zahra, and I say to everyone else, because she's right next to me, we've got a T in the passage here, but there's a big fucking hole in the way, so we're going to need to use our neverending rope, perhaps, or some means of getting over this hole if we want to go forward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or into the hole. Maybe it goes further down.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I could use my cloak and I could fly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have a-- wait.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I have a Cloak of the Bat. And I can use mine to investigate left or right, whichever side you'd like, and I can do a quick investigation and come back and see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can fly?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can. I can also cast flight on all of us, but that would-- I think, at this point, it might be best to do a single investigation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How strong are you?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, but I can get in and get out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can't carry any one person over? Maybe a gnome?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could maybe try to leap from the sides of the hole or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where it meets this center area, it's only about a five-foot step over.

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the other parts of the intersection.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could totally parkour that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're just going catty-corner, it would be a relatively easy acrobatics check. Barring you don't roll a one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold on, shush. Eenie, meany, miney, mo. Catch a tiger by the toe--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do you want to go left, I'll go right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) I think we should go down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eenie, meany, miney, mo. We go rightwards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we look down? Can we just look down?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Does my darkvision extend at all 60 feet down into the hole to see what's there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as you guys approach, Vax deftly attempts to leap over to the right side of the T-junction. Make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 30-something. 30--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you are immediately met with... a wall. It ends to the right. It's almost like across the way and immediately to the right both just end abruptly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there's nothing here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see there are symbols burned into what looks to be some sort of a bird head that ends in these streaks that are carved into the rock. Intricately, and done with a very careful hand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (groans) There's a bunch of bullshit on this wall and a raven's head, and I don't know what any of it fucking means.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I use my Cloak of the Bat to fly over and to read it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, you can read bullshit?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can read bullshit. I have--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I read bullshit.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Eyes of the Runekeeper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you can make a religion check.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Are we up there with them now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have stepped up to the edge of the tunnel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That little ledge won't support-- I mean, is it a long hallway that ends abruptly, or is it this much space?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's maybe ten, 15 feet beyond the break.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. This being a tomb of a champion of the Raven Queen, looking at this, you gather this is the symbol of the Raven Queen.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's the symbol of the Raven Queen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah, that makes sense.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (long pause)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sploosh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's pretty deep, guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do I hear if I knock on the wall that we're looking at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (quiet knocking) Solid stone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Doesn't feel hollow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I, since it's only five feet away on the left, can I look around and see if it looks like there's any similar sort of traps or anything down that hallway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Instead, you're met with a large, ten foot tall, eight to ten foot wide double set of doors.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doors.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hop over to where the doors are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hop over to the doors, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Both of you guys make acrobatics checks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus, don't fall. (high-pitched noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Yeah, you guys make it across fine.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I just fly over and land?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kima's getting impatient, and she joins you guys across that way. She's fine on her roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll jump over towards the doors as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Acrobatics check.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Me, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. I rolled an 18.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yeah, 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rolled a one.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? MATT; So, as all of you start leaping across into this small tunnel right before the doors, taking a moment to inspect it, the final member of the group right before Trinket, who rolled a two--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You rolled for Trinket?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Don't worry, Trinket's fine. The one was the killer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you hear a (yelp) as suddenly, that slime-like mass that you've seen appearing throughout the stonework here has also gathered itself along the edge of this open crevasse in the hallway. Your foot hits it and within a moment, the stones beneath your feet are beneath your feet no more, and you find yourself about to plummet into this--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I leap forward and try to grab him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is happening very quickly. I need you to go ahead and make a dexterity saving throw to see if you can manage to catch the edge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17? Actually, no, because there is slime on this, I need you to make it a roll with disadvantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
